newsitem.title: BANGLADESH: Dhaka stocks seen falling amid cautious trading.
newsitem.headline: Dhaka stocks seen falling amid cautious trading.

text.p: Shares on the Dhaka Stock Exchange (DSE) may ease amid cautious trading when the market reopens after the Moslem Friday weekend, brokers said.

"The market may continue to remain bearish as the investors are expected to be cautious in trading. They will prefer to watch the market before making any move," said Golam Sarwar of Mahbub Morshed & Co. Prices may fall across the board, he said.
The DSE all-share price index closed 74.37 points or 2.79 percent down at 2,587.24 on a turnover of 77 million taka on Thursday. -- Dhaka Newsroom +880-2-506363
